meanings.definition: The highest point reached by a celestial or other object.
meanings.sent1: At the zenith of the mountain, the climbers could see the entire valley below.
meanings.sent2: The sun was directly overhead at its zenith in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was the zenith of cleverness when it caught the laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: Her happiness reached its zenith when she received the award.
meanings.sent5: The zenith of the roller coaster ride was when it reached the top and paused before the drop.

meanings.definition: The point in the sky directly above an observer.
meanings.sent1: Looking up, she saw a shooting star pass through the zenith of the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The moon was visible at the zenith, shining brightly.
meanings.sent3: The bird flew so high it seemed to reach the zenith and touch the sky.
meanings.sent4: In her painting, the artist captured the beauty of the stars surrounding the zenith.
meanings.sent5: The zenith of the eclipse was when the moon perfectly covered the sun.

meanings.definition: The peak or highest point of something.
meanings.sent1: The company's profits reached their zenith this quarter.
meanings.sent2: The zenith of the pyramid gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The cake decorator placed a cherry on the zenith of the cake.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's career hit its zenith when he won the championship.
meanings.sent5: The zenith of the mountain was covered in snow, glistening in the sun.
